definition: see 黑板報|黑板报[hei1 ban3 bao4]
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious
blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)

sentences.english: The competition of English newsletter constructs strong atmosphere of learning English.
sentences.chinese: 英语板报的评比营造了学习英语的浓浓氛围。

sentences.english: The postern by exquisite blackboard newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 后门边由精致的黑板报。

sentences.english: I think it an honour to be selected simply because editor of the wexcellentspaper.
sentences.chinese: 我以为，被选上板报编辑是一种信用。

sentences.english: A poster at the Beijie School construction site.
sentences.chinese: 北街小学施工现场的张贴板报。

sentences.english: These were classroom decorations at KPMG Zhangqi Hope School.
sentences.chinese: 在张旗毕马威苗圃希望小学斑房里的板报。

sentences.english: She is good at drawing and is the producer and painter of every poster in high school.
sentences.chinese: 高中时，所有的班级板报都是她设计并参与绘制的。

sentences.english: That's our Bulletin Board, and I hope you like it.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们班的板报设计，希望大家喜欢。

sentences.english: He is in charge of a publication in the school, and is responsible for a blackboard newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 他在学校是宣传委员，负责出每期的黑板报。

sentences.english: Over the past few weeks the students have been working on creating a new billboard design for our classroom.
sentences.chinese: 过去几周同学们都在忙着为教室设计新的板报。

definition: blackboard bulletin with short news items written on it (can usually be found in factories, schools etc)
Young Pioneers of China, abbr. for 少年先鋒隊|少年先锋队[Shao4 nian2 Xian1 feng1 dui4]
